file_content.text: The flames will die when we win Corellia. Appreciate the fire while it lasts.
The rebels are finished.
Good, good. The rebellion weakens with every blow. Soon they'll be nothing but ash and a distant memory.
The rebels should have stayed in the flames.
The flames called you here, too, didn't they? Pity you missed the show.
Our bombs plummeted in silence, then blossomed, giving birth to the magnificent inferno.
I yearn for the flames' warm embrace. Instead, I can only watch the fire reduce the rebel factories to ash.
You've clearly lost it.
Fire is destruction distilled to its purest form. You'd do well to respect it.
Fire embodies a Sith's rage, our strength, our capacity for destruction.
I know exactly what you mean.
Few things are more satisfying than a raging fire.
I know exactly what you mean.
Exactly. The blaze deserves our reverence.
Keep your ideas to yourself.
I'm sorry. My mind wanders when the flames are close.
I came to nurse the inferno and watch the blaze consume the rebels. Sadly, the flames were denied their pleasure.
Too many Corellians escaped the fire. Republic doctors treat them, poisoning the survivors against the Empire and fueling their rebellion.
If the rebels continue to oppose us, we will burn them off Corellia.
Then we must stomp them out.
Don't they know the fire won't stop until the rebels kneel before us?
How stubborn of them.
We must make them learn.
If flames won't teach the rebels cooperation, perhaps they require the Empire's personal touch.
We must hit the rebels again.
Yes. It's the only way.
The Corellians despised you Imps before you even invaded. The firebombs didn't exactly help.
They already hated the Empire.
Then we will scorch the doubt from their minds.
So the firebombing failed.
It's not that bad. We simply must fan the flames of destruction.
I don't care about the rebels.
Surely you care about taking this planet. The resistance is our only obstacle.
Crush the survivors, and the rebels will realize that defiance earns them death!
I'd cast them into the inferno myself, but the flames, so close I--I'd never resist them. Perhaps you could fuel the blaze with rebel blood.
I'd love to.
The rebels will die.
Good. Find their medical camp. Burn their resistance to the ground.
No way, psycho. [Refuse quest]
When the rebels snuff out the last embers, it will be on your head.
The heat, the smoke, the ash in the air. Isn't it wonderful?
